name: src/entry.js
src/js/classlist.js
classlist
description:
Wrap an element in a classlist-like object such that it can add and remove classes
in a manner compatible with ie8+

params.name: element
params.description: The element to wrap in a classlist object so it can use .add(), .remove() etc.
params.descriptionRaw:
The element to wrap in a classlist object so it can use `.add()`, `.remove()`
etc.

return.description: The API that acts entirely on the element provided.
return.descriptionRaw: The API that acts entirely on the element provided.

name: src/js/dom.js
find
description:
Finds an element by selector within a context. If child elements in 
element match selector, they are added to the return result

unknown.tagValue: {array|Node} A single element or collection of elements that match the query

params.name: element
params.description: The element to search for children inside of
params.descriptionRaw: The element to search for children inside of

params.name: selector
params.description: The CSS selector to match elements against
params.descriptionRaw: The CSS selector to match elements against

return.description: A single element or collection of elements that match the query
return.descriptionRaw: A single element or collection of elements that match the query

name: query
description:
Finds an element by selector within the context of context (document.body 
if no context is supplied). This is a bare-bones analog of jQuery's `$()`

unknown.tagValue: {array|Node} A single element or collection of elements that match the query

params.name: selector
params.description: The CSS selector to match elements against
params.descriptionRaw: The CSS selector to match elements against

params.name: context
params.description: The element to search inside of
params.descriptionRaw: The element to search inside of

return.description: A single element or collection of elements that match the query
return.descriptionRaw: A single element or collection of elements that match the query

name: closest
description:
Finds the closest parent element of element that matches selector
starting with the element this function was passed

unknown.tagValue: {Node} The first ancestor element that matches the query

params.name: element
params.description: The element from which to begin the search
params.descriptionRaw: The element from which to begin the search

params.name: selector
params.description: The CSS selector to match elements against
params.descriptionRaw: The CSS selector to match elements against

return.description: The first ancestor element that matches the query
return.descriptionRaw: The first ancestor element that matches the query

name: parent
description: Returns the immediate parent of a given node

params.name: element
params.description: The element from which to return a parent
params.descriptionRaw: The element from which to return a parent

return.description: element - The parent element of the element passed in
return.descriptionRaw: element - The parent element of the element passed in

name: children
description:
Returns an array of children of the passed in element. Will return a single element
if the array contains only one child.

params.name: element
params.description: The element from which to retrieve children
params.descriptionRaw: The element from which to retrieve children

return.description: element - The children of element
return.descriptionRaw: element - The children of element

name: siblings
description:
Returns siblings of a given node. If a selector is specified, it will
return only the siblings that match that selector.

params.name: element
params.description: The element from which to return a parent
params.descriptionRaw: The element from which to return a parent

params.name: selector
params.description: the selector to match elements against
params.descriptionRaw: the selector to match elements against

return.description: element - The sibling(s) of the element passed in.
return.descriptionRaw: element - The sibling(s) of the element passed in.

name: src/js/element.js
attr
description: a getter/setter function that modifies attributes on elements.

params.name: element
params.description: The element to set attributes on
params.descriptionRaw: The element to set attributes on

params.name: attribute
params.description: The attribute to either retrieve or replace with a value
params.descriptionRaw: The attribute to either retrieve or replace with a value

params.name: val
params.description: The value to set, if any
params.descriptionRaw: The value to set, if any

return.description: undefined
return.descriptionRaw: undefined

name: removeAttr
description: a function to remove attributes on elements

params.name: element
params.description: The element to remove attributes from
params.descriptionRaw: The element to remove attributes from

params.name: attribute
params.description: The attribute on the element to remove
params.descriptionRaw: The attribute on the element to remove

return.description: undefined
return.descriptionRaw: undefined

name: value
description: a function to retrieve or set the value of a form element.

params.name: element
params.description: The element on which to retrieve or set the value
params.descriptionRaw: The element on which to retrieve or set the value

params.name: val
params.description: The value to set (or retrieve) as the elements value
params.descriptionRaw: The value to set (or retrieve) as the elements value

return.description: The value of the element
return.descriptionRaw: The value of the element

name: addClass
description:
A function that adds a class to the element provided using a 
polyfill wrapper for Element.classlist

params.name: element
params.description: The element on which to add one (or many, space separated) class(es)
params.descriptionRaw: The element on which to add one (or many, space separated) class(es)

params.name: classes
params.description: The classes to add to the element
params.descriptionRaw: The classes to add to the element

return.description: The element on which the class was set
return.descriptionRaw: The element on which the class was set

name: removeClass
description:
A function that removes a class from the element provided using a
polyfill wrapper for Element.classlist

params.name: element
params.description: The element on which to remove one (or many, space separated) class(es)
params.descriptionRaw: The element on which to remove one (or many, space separated) class(es)

params.name: classes
params.description: The classes to remove from the element
params.descriptionRaw: The classes to remove from the element

return.description: The element on which the class was set
return.descriptionRaw: The element on which the class was set

name: css
description: A function to set inline CSS properties onto an element

params.name: element
params.description: The element on which to remove one (or many, space separated) class(es)
params.descriptionRaw: The element on which to remove one (or many, space separated) class(es)

params.name: styles
params.description: The styles, in camel-case (if applicable), to set on the element
params.descriptionRaw: The styles, in camel-case (if applicable), to set on the element

return.description: The element on which the class was set
return.descriptionRaw: The element on which the class was set

name: append
description: Append a child node to the end of an element's children

params.name: element
params.description: The element to append a child to
params.descriptionRaw: The element to append a child to

params.name: appendee
params.description: The element that will be moved or appended to the new parent element
params.descriptionRaw:
The element that will be moved or appended to the 
new parent element

return.description: The element that was appended to the parent
return.descriptionRaw: The element that was appended to the parent

name: prepend
description: Append a child node to the beginning of an element's children

params.name: element
params.description: The element to prepend a child to
params.descriptionRaw: The element to prepend a child to

params.name: prependee
params.description: The element that will be moved or prepended to the new parent element
params.descriptionRaw:
The element that will be moved or prepended to the 
new parent element

return.description: The element that was prepended to the parent
return.descriptionRaw: The element that was prepended to the parent

name: empty
description: Utility to empty elements child contents completely via `innerHTML`

params.name: element
params.description: The element to empty
params.descriptionRaw: The element to empty

return.description: The newly emptied element.
return.descriptionRaw: The newly emptied element.

name: clone
description: Clones a node, optionally deep clones the node to also clone its children

params.name: element
params.description: The element to clone
params.descriptionRaw: The element to clone

params.name: deep
params.description: The flag to determine whether or not the copy is deep
params.descriptionRaw: The flag to determine whether or not the copy is deep

return.description: The newly cloned node
return.descriptionRaw: The newly cloned node

name: remove
description: Removes a node from the DOM

params.name: element
params.description: The element to remove from the DOM.
params.descriptionRaw: The element to remove from the DOM.

return.description: The newly removed element
return.descriptionRaw: The newly removed element

name: src/js/event.js
src/js/internal/helpers.js
_each
description:
A for-each loop type function that can be run on arrays, it begins from the end of the list for the 
reason that it makes the burden on duplicate removal using indexOf far lighter. IE8 doesn't support Array.forEach
so this fulfills that functionality.

params.name: collection
params.description: The array to run `fn` against

params.name: fn
params.description: The function that accepts each element, index, and the collection itself.

return.description: undefined.

name: _uniques
description: A function that runs along an array and returns only unique values

params.name: collection
params.description: The array to filter for uniques

return.description: A new array containing the unique elements from `collection`.

name: _exclude
description: Excludes an element from an array

params.name: collection
params.description: The array to search through for exclusions

params.name: item
params.description: The function that accepts each element, index, and the collection itself.

return.description: the collection without the specified item

name: _unwrap
description:
Unwraps an element from an array if it's the only element in the array. This was created
to allow selectors that match to only a single DOM element to be interactive without having to
grab the first element of the returned collection array.

params.name: collection
params.description: The array of data

return.description: the item as-is or an array of items

name: _nodes
description:
Returns all nodes of an array collection. This function can also be used generically for 
almost any data type, but it should only be used with DOM elements.

params.name: collection
params.description: The array to search through for child Nodes

return.description: the collection of all Nodes.

name: _elements
description:
Filters Element nodes of an array of Nodes. This filters out every node that is NOT and element node
(e.g. TextNode, CommentNode, AttributeNode, etc.)

params.name: collection
params.description: The array to search through for elements

return.description: a new array containing only elements

name: src/js/markup.js
create
description:
Create html markup in a manner similar to jQuery's usage of $("
") et. al.

params.name: markup
params.description: The html markup you'd like to have created
params.descriptionRaw: The html markup you'd like to have created

return.description: The result of your HTML input, appendable to the DOM.
return.descriptionRaw: The result of your HTML input, appendable to the DOM.

name: html
description:
A functional style mirror of jQuery's `html()`. This function will 
create markup if `markup` is specified, and will retrieve markup if only
`element` is provided.

params.name: element
params.description: The element to either set or retrieve html to/from
params.descriptionRaw: The element to either set or retrieve html to/from

params.name: markup
params.description: The markup to assign to this element's innerHTML
params.descriptionRaw: The markup to assign to this element's `innerHTML`

return.description: The element that was appended to the parent
return.descriptionRaw: The element that was appended to the parent

name: text
description: Sets an elements `textContent`

params.name: element
params.description: The element on which to retrieve or set text
params.descriptionRaw: The element on which to retrieve or set text

params.name: content
params.description: The content to set for the element's text value
params.descriptionRaw: The content to set for the element's text value

name: _normalize
description: Helper function to remove excess space between html tags

params.name: markup
params.description: The markup to sanitize for spaces.

return.description: The normalized markup with no extraneous spaces.

name: src/js/polyfills/polyfills.js
